instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> video artifacts
threads.message:
Hi guys, 

I've got a MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with video artifacts. Normally I would consider this a dGPU problem, but it doesn't have one. Any ideas?

Thanks, Rick

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> video artifacts
threads.message:
i had this problem with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, begining by video artefacts, finish by 3 beeps and black screen at startup, reflow ram solved problem for me probably corrosion.
Work some time and 3 beep again i have reballing all ram and solved this problem but A lot of wasted time

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> video artifacts
threads.message: RAM issue likely. Can you make a picture?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> video artifacts
threads.message: Customer changed his mind and isn't going to get this fixed, thankfully. Thanks for your help.
